okay!!!!!

q: no.
a: yeah-yeah, me neither.

q: what are you doing?
a: the key’s stuck in the lock.

q: i can fix it. hold on. (he goes and gets a screwdriver from his apartment) look out. look out. (pries at the door a little bit.)
a: (trying the handle) it still doesn’t work.

q: i’m not finished.
a: oh. nice job joe! you’re quite the craftsmen.

q: in case you’re wondering, and i know you are. their names are all back to normal. just in a slightly smaller font than usual to allow courteney cox arquette to fit on one line and not be smaller than the rest of their names. now, on with the show…}
a: y’know when we move in together, can i get a gumball machine?

q: of course! joey wouldn’t let you have one?
a: no. when it comes to sweets, he’s surprisingly strict.

q: hey, have you figured out a way to tell him you’re moving out?
a: no, no, i keep trying, y’know? i can get out, "joey, i have too…" but then i lose my nerve and i always finish with, "…go to the bathroom." he may think i’m sick.

q: y’know, i really have to tell rachel, but i… we just have to get it over with! y’know, the next time we see them we’re just gonna tell them. okay? that’s it.
a: oh, so that’s this is gonna work now? you’re just gonna order me around all the time?

q: pretty much.
a: all right.

q: oh my god! you’re pregnant!
a: no-o-o! (to monica) no? (she nods no.) no-o-o! look joey, here’s the thing, monica and i have decided to live together, here. so, i’m gonna be moving out man.

q: yeah, i gotta go! i got an acting job. (turns towards the door, pauses, and turns back.) like you’d believe that. this sucks!
a: look, i-i’m just gonna be right across the hall and i promise you, the minute monica and i break up i’m moving right back in with you!

q: and if you wait right here, i’ll go get ross. (phoebe grabs his arm and prevents him from escaping.)
a: (entering) hey!

q: ugh, i thought you were rachel!
a: (looking down) what gave me away?

q: i just tell her, i have to get it over with. i told ross and phoebe and she’s the only one left!
a: okay, so that’s it, everybody knows! it’s official, we’re moving in together. no turning back. are ya scared? are ya?

q: no.
a: wow that was my scariest voice! you’re very brave.

q: hey!
a: hey.

q: ugh, the worse day! y’know, you think you’re making progress at work and then your boss calls you raquel.
a: hey listen, for the first four years of my work everybody called me sha-la-lap. (awkward silence ensues.) seriously.

q: i believe you. so, it was right in the middle of a staff meeting so of course no one else wants to correct her so everyone else is calling me raquel! by the end of the day, the mailroom guys were calling me rocky!
a: well, i-i still think you’re very-very nice and very pretty…

q: what?
a: (to monica) all yours babe. (walks away.)

q: and chandler, you’re gonna have to watch those long showers you take in the morning because you know raquel can’t be late.
a: rach…

q: i am so attracted to him right now.
a: okay, when are we gonna tell rachel what is actually gonna happen?

q: soon! i-i just couldn’t before. you saw how upset joey got! i couldn’t do that to her, she’s my best friend!
a: well, joey’s my best friend.

q: i’m not your best friend?
a: you just said… of course you’re my best friend. would you please tell rachel though?

q: all right, all right, at least i’m prepared.
a: okay. (she grabs a tin of freshly baked cookies) oh yes. (he reaches for one.)

q: (slapping his hand) hey!
a: hey-hey!

q: these aren’t for you! are you upset?
a: i am now!

q: (entering) hey roomie!
a: okay, bye! (exits.)

q: god, it’s gonna so weird like when i come home and you’re not here. y’know? no more joey and chan’s. no more j and c’s. "you wanna go over to joey and chandler’s?" "can’t, its not there."
a: look, i’m just gonna be across the hall, we can still do all the same stuff.

q: yeah but we won’t be able to like get up in the middle of the night and have those long talks about our feelings and the future.
a: not once did we do that.

q: (entering) hi.
a: hey!

q: so i, i told rachel it was just gonna be the two of us.
a: oh yeah? well, how’d she take it?

q: really well. yeah. surprisingly well. yeah, she didn’t cry. she wasn’t angry or sad. (sits down, slightly disgusted.)
a: and you’re upset because you didn’t make your best friend cry?

q: hey! i did not cry my eyes out!! come on! it’s like the end of an era! no more j-man and channie’s!!
a: okay, i gotta ask, who calls us that?!

q: i don’t want to go into the whole thing, but umm, we have words and i kill him.
a: (entering) hey!

q: hey, what is with the secrecy phoebe? huh? and what about this denise, is she cute?
a: pheebs, i don’t understand. how can you have a roommate that none of us know anything about?

q: yeah, yeah i think i’m gonna find my own place.
a: hey-hey! i thought naked thursday’s was just our thing man!

q: hey! (to chandler) dude, some guy just called for you.
a: who was it?

q: okay listen, y’know when you move in rachel’s room is gonna be empty, you wanna talk about what we want to do with it?
a: sure!

q: okay, i was thinking we should have a beautiful guest room, right? with a mahogany sleigh bed and bedside tables with flowers on them all the time! and we could have a roll top desk with comment cards on them so people could say how much they loved staying here!! okay, whatever, i really haven’t thought about it that much.
a: well, i like that idea. obviously! i was thinking maybe-maybe-maybe it could be a game room, y’know? i mean you can buy old arcade games like uh, like space invaders and asteroids for $200, the real ones! the big-big ones!

q: no.
a: okay so you mean no as in, "gee chandler, what an interesting idea. let’s discuss it before we reject it completely."

q: oh, i’m sorry. of course i mean that. interesting idea, umm, talk about it, but no.
a: so, that’s it?

q: i just don’t think arcade games go in the beautiful guest room. the beautiful guest room is gonna be filled with antiques.
a: which is why asteroids is perfect! it’s the oldest game!

q: what do you have against the beautiful guest room?
a: i don’t have anything against the beautiful guest room, especially since everybody we know lives about 30 seconds away!

q: are you mocking me?
a: no, i’m not mocking you, (in a mocking voice) or you beautiful guest room. (exits.)

q: hey, what’s up?
a: nothing, monica and i had a stupid fight.

q: but you’re still moving in together, right? because my ad came out today. (shows him the paper.)
a: (reading the ad) "wanted. female roommate, non-smoker, non-ugly." nice!

q: no. no, i won’t. but i should tell you this, this exact same thing happened to my roommate denise. she moved in with a guy who was secretly married to her and he said he didn’t love her, but he really did, and it just blew up! and that’s how she ended up living with me! (ross looks at her.) (pause) okay, that’s a lie.
a: hi.

q: hi.
a: hi, listen, i’m sorry about before. i don’t need to have a game room. i mean when i was a kid i only played those games because i couldn’t get girls, and now i can ‘em—now, i have you. (monica glares at him.) not-not that i think that i have you or think of you as property in any sort of way, i see women…

q: stop it chandler. (chandler is relieved) i’m sorry too.
a: really?

q: yeah! oh yes!
a: ohh.

q: listen, we don’t have to make that a guest room, we can think of something to do with the room together.
a: that’s a great idea! we can easily think of a way for us both to enjoy the room.

q: totally!
a: we don’t have to come up with this now.

q: oh good.
a: hey, y’know what? why don’t we think about changes we can make in the living room?

q: changes?
a: yeah, i mean we’re gonna have to move around some furniture to make room for my chair. (kisses her and heads into the living room.)

q: you’re-you’re-you’re gonna bring the barca lounger over here?
a: is that a problem?

q: well, it’s a set and they should probably stay together.
a: oh, that’s cool. then i’ll just bring them both over.

q: see now-now you’re taking them away from their home.
a: okay, i get it. so, i get nothing! nothing here is mine! everything here is yours! i’ll get up in the morning put on your clothes, and head off to work!

q: yeah-yeah, y’know what? yeah, that’s it-that’s it, everything will be mine! nothing will be yours! that’s-that’s what i said! oh come on, chandler! i’m talking about the barca lounger! it just, it doesn’t match! where is it gonna go?!
a: in the game room!

q: look it is not my fault that your chairs are incredibly ugly!
a: all right! that’s fine! that’s fine! i won’t bring over the chairs! i won’t bring anything over! i wouldn’t want to ruin the ambiance over here at grandma’s place!! (storms out.)

q: whoa!! now look, don’t be just blurtin’ stuff out. i want you to really think about your answers. okay?
a: (entering) you can call off the roommate search! (to the potential roommate) hi! i’ll be living here. (heads for the bathroom.)

q: oh don’t listen to him, he’s just some guy who really wants the apartment, but i don’t think he’s gonna get it.
a: why did you take the shower curtain down?

q: well, apparently not, and i can’t just stand by and watch two people i care about very much be hurt over something that is so silly. i mean, enough of the silliness!
a: well, why don’t you tell her to stop being silly! (monica mocks him and he joins in.)

q: (stopping them) okay-okay! two very good points, look i’ve known you both a long time, and i’ve never seen either of you one/millionth as happy as you’ve been since you’ve got together. do you really want to throw that all away over a room? that is so silly. now wh-what is more important, love or silliness?
a: well, we are fond of the silliness, but we also have a soft spot for the love.

q: love is the best medicine.
a: that’s laughter.

q: why do you do it?
a: i don’t know.

q: okay! all right! now, chandler you-you wanna live with monica, right?
a: yeah, i do.

q: that’s very funny!
a: he’s being silly, because he knows that we enjoy the silliness!

q: okay, there are no stupid fights!! this isn’t about the room, this is about what the room…represents! and unfortunately, this room (points to rachel’s room) could destroy you!!
a: yeah, i'm not so worried.

q: you still want to move in together right?
a: of course!

q: ross didn’t scare you?
a: scared me out of ever wanting to live with him.

q: come here, i want to show you something!
a: okay! oh my god! someone’s killed square man!

q: this is where i thought the barca lounger could go! you see you could see the tv and it’s still walking distance to the kitchen.
a: oh that’s so sweet! i want to show you something too!

q: okay!
a: y’know those big-big uh, road signs that say "merge?"

q: uh-hmm.
a: y’know? so i was thinking that we could get one of those signs and hang it over our bed. because, that’s you and i together! merge!

q: oh my god! i love that!
a: really?!

q: (to ross) saved your ass.
a: hey!

q: hey!
a: oh, what’s the matter?

q: well, you know that psychic i see?
a: yeah?

q: well, she told me that i’m gonna die this week, so i’m kinda bummed about that.
a: what?!

q: i don’t—she said y’know that i’d have triplets! but she also said one of them would be black.
a: just out of curiosity did she tell you how you’re gonna go?

q: (entering) hey everyone!
a: oh hi!

q: ohh! okay! okay. (resumes reading word for word from the card) "there are three (pauses and looks at joey) primary theories concerning sediment flow rate. (pauses and darts his eyes between chandler and rachel.) (rachel starts laughing) each of these theories (glances at phoebe) can be further subcategorized (glances at chandler) into…"
a: why don’t you open with a joke?

q: open with a joke? it’s a university, not a comedy club!
a: wait a minute, hold the phone! you’re not talking about chuckles university?!

q: i-i-i don’t even know why i bother to talk to you guys about it. y’know what? i’m just gonna do it on my own with no naked chicks.
a: that’s the way i did it ‘til i was 19. hey.

q: hey! any good mail?
a: yes, you got something from the screen actor’s guild.

q: ooh, it’s probably a residual check, hey can you open it for me, i’m kinda….
a: (opens and reads it) "benefits lapsed."

q: hmm that’s weird. i don’t remember being in a move called benefits lapsed.
a: okay, it’s not a check. they’re saying your health insurance expired because, you didn’t work enough last year.

q: let me see that!
a: all right.

q: (reads it) oh, i can’t believe this! this sucks! when i had insurance i could get hit by a bus or catch on fire, y’know? and it wouldn’t matter. now i gotta be careful?!
a: i’m sorry man, there’s never a good time to (pauses) stop catching on fire.

q: all right well, i guess i gotta go get a job. i’m gonna go see my agent.
a: okay, make sure you look both ways before you cross the street.

q: bastard!
a: hey!

q: (in obvious pain) hey! so estelle lined up a bunch of auditions for me tomorrow and i’ll have my health insurance back in no time.
a: that’s great, but shouldn’t you be on the toilet right now?

q: what?!
a: what’s wrong with you?

q: nothing! well, i-i got this blinding pain in my stomach when i was lifting weights before, then i uh passed out and uh, haven’t been able to stand up since. but um, i don’t think it’s anything serious.
a: this sounds like a hernia. you have to—you-you go to the doctor!

q: no way! ‘kay look, if i have to go to the doctor for anything it’s gonna be for this thing sticking out of my stomach! (rolls over and shows chandler.)
a: that’s a hernia.

q: (in an indian accent) yes, yes, bombay is bery, bery nice time of year.
a: hey, will you grab me a cruller? (joey starts to groan and get up.) sit down! will you go to the hospital?!

q: dude! hernia operations cost like, a lot probably. besides it’s getting darker and more painful, that means it’s healing.
a: i will loan you the money. just go to the hospital and let’s just get that thing…pushed back in.

q: hey!
a: hey.

q: what’s going on?
a: oh joey’s got a really bad hernia, but that’s nothing a little laser eye surgery won’t fix!

q: eh, better her than me! hey, let’s bake cookies!
a: listen, i’m really glad you got the part.

q: (barely audible through the pain) thank you.
a: but are you sure you can do this?

q: yeah! and hey, thanks for coming with me. and thanks again for helping me take a shower.
a: now, is that never talking about it again?!

q: cut!!!!!!!!!! (joey starts screaming again.)
a: i’m sorry! hey-hey joe, why don’t you uh, lift up your shirt? (he does.) take a look at this kiddo. (alex finally starts crying.) we have a crying child! roll the damn cameras!

q: hey-hey-hey!
a: what are you doing?

q: we’re just celebrating that joey got his health insurance back.
a: oh, all right.

q: when?! after the birth of our first secret child?! (to all) ross didn’t get the annulment; we are still married.
a: what?

q: okay, maybe it wasn’t my best decision. but i just couldn’t face another failed marriage.
a: okay, let me just jump in and ask, at what point did you think this was a successful marriage?

q: another lie. you have a sickness!
a: ross, just for my own piece of mind, you’re not married to anymore of us are ya?

q: there’s a lost and found? (gunther sets the box up on the table.) my shoe! (grabs it out of the box.)
a: you left a shoe here?!

q: well, i didn’t realize until i got home. i wasn’t gonna walk all the way back down here with one shoe! y’know what? i’m gonna go find that guy’s car and leave a note on the windshield. (goes to do so.)
a: oh good, when he comes back for his keys, i’ll be sure to give him your shoe.

q: oh my god, what a fun day! that sounds great!
a: (not enthused) yeah, all right.

q: okay, well i’ll bring them by tomorrow morning. okay, and uh, by the way, they’re not actually puppies, they’re frank and alice’s triplets. okay, see ya! (exits.)
a: whoa-whoa-whoa! what?

q: don’t worry about it phoebe, we’ll absolutely do it.
a: yeah, i’m gonna pass. ‘cause i was kinda iffy when it was puppies.

q: nope, sound like me. pheebs, it’s going great. look at chandler with little baby girl chandler.
a: little baby girl chandler, where i have heard that before? oh right, coach ruben. (tries to get her to drink a little more from the bottle when he suddenly smells something. it’s times like these i’m glad smell-o-vision hasn’t been invented.) do you know what pheebs? when you’re done over there, we kinda have a situation over here too. (phoebe is changing hers.)

q: na-uh, no, we are all responsible for our own babies.
a: see that’s where i think that you’re wrong. we’ve been playing these babies man for man; we should really be playing a zone defense.

q: what do you mean?
a: i just think that things would go a lot smoother if we each have our own zone. phoebe, you can be in charge of wiping. and y’know mon, you can be in charge of diapering and i can be in charge of looking how cute they are when they put their hands around… (he degrades into baby talk, but he means when they grab his finger.)

q: that sounds really great, but maybe you should be in charge of wiping.
a: okay, i’m a rookie. i should not be in the end zone.

q: (entering) hey guys!
a: hey!

q: hey babies! oh, i’m having the best morning. that uh, that porsche i’ve got the keys too, still there!
a: shocking! since you still have the keys.

q: you should see the treatment i get when i’m with that car! people are friendly; they-they wanna talk, and not just about the car! one guy gave me advice about my equity investments.
a: what equity investments?

q: oh yeah, i got soap and sponges and rags and carnuba wax and polishing compound.
a: you don’t even have a car!

q: i know. but umm, one time there was this really dirty car in front of the building, so i washed it.
a: and?

q: and six others.
a: there you are.

q: yeah, two hours, a lifetime that’s the same.
a: (entering) check it out! check it out! when the babies wake up, they can meet krog! (he holds up this xena-like warrior action figure.)

q: chandler, what are you doing? that thing can put someone’s eye out!
a: he can do more than that! he can destroy the universe!

q: no chandler, they can swallow one of those little parts! and also, look at his smooth area, that’s just gonna mess them up.
a: they’re not gonna swallow anything, you guys are being way over protective. when i was a kid, my mom used to just throw me into a pile of broken glass!

q: what?!
a: glass, sand, whatever. (walks out as monica and phoebe turn to check on the babies again.)

q: how are you still single?!
a: (entering) all right. (clears throat) i thought about it and maybe you’re right. maybe krog is not a safe toy.

q: good. what made you change your mind?
a: i swallowed the sonic blaster gun.

q: how did that happen?!!
a: well, i was trying to prove that i was right. y’know? and it turns out i was wrong. and now it’s lodged in my throat. (mimics a cat trying to cough up a hairball.) (he does it again.)

q: (entering wearing nothing but porsche clothes) so the porsche guy took his car back.
a: but you found the keys to his clothes?

q: of course! only an idiot would wear this stuff if you didn’t have the car! right?
a: that is true.

q: come on! what are you doing?! i’m in character! would you talk to her! (storms out.)
a: ahh, i think it just moved. it’s really poking me.

q: but no, because a doctor won’t be able to help him, it’s just gonna y’know naturally pass through his system in like seven years.
a: i think that’s gum.

q: i’m pretty sure it’s gun.
a: okay, listen this really hurts. let’s go.

q: me taking care of you is no problem, huh? you guys feel safe. right? okay, i’m gonna take that spit bubble as, "yeah, i do!" okay, after i get rid of this dirty diaper leslie, i’ll set you up with a clean one. (she throws it at the garbage without looking, misses, and knocks over a vase and flowers, which fall to the floor and break.) okay, i’m sorry. i didn’t mean to scare you. i just have to clean that up. okay? ‘cause let’s face it, we’re at monica’s. (she crawls over, disposes of the diaper, picks up the flowers, and the vase.) i broke it. all right. well, that’s just the way that goes. (she throws out both the flowers and the vase.) okay, good. (she turns around and only counts two babies.) why are there only two of you? where is leslie? well, you can’t answer. (she starts looking for her) leslie? where are you leslie? leslie, now would be a good time for your first words! (she turns around and finds that leslie has managed to crawl into the bottom drawer of the tv cabinet.) well, look at you! hey! you are a little bit mischievous! my gosh! (she picks her up and notices a surprise is waiting in the drawer.) oh, you’re a lot mischievous! well, it’ll dry. (closes the drawer with her foot.) (to leslie) okay, you sit with your brother and sister now—who aren’t there! (they both have disappeared as well.)
a: (entering) hey!

q: (exhausted) how do you feel?
a: well, let’s just say that krog will be fully equipped to destroy the universe again in twelve to fourteen hours.

q: okay, so i totally took care of the babies all by myself! i fed ‘em, bathed ‘em, and put ‘em to bed.
a: and protected them from a tornado?

q: but my apartment!
a: was the setting of phoebe’s triumph.

q: but the mess!
a: is not as important as the fact that phoebe took care of the babies all by herself.

q: you’re right, you’re right i shouldn’t freak out. ‘cause this is what will happen when you and i have babies! when will that be?!
a: (pause) phoebe, would you take a look at this mess!!!!

q: i’d love to show ya, but i just tucked her in. she’s sleeping. (the women both laugh) hey uh, would you two girls like to go for a drink? (just then the same guy with the football dives to make a catch, lands on the car cover, and collapses it. it turns out that joey set up a bunch of boxes to make it look like a porsche.)
a: (watches joey for a moment) okay! (joey quickly moves the hockey stick so that he’s scratching his back with it.) listen, i’m gonna be moving out so you will be in charge of paying the rent.

q: right! and when is that due?
a: first of the month.

q: and that’s every month?
a: no, just the months you actually want to live here.

q: ahhh.
a: okay, here is the phone bill. (hands it to joey.)

q: (looking at it) oh my god!!
a: that’s our phone number. now look, i know i kinda sprung this whole me moving out on thing, so why don’t i just—why don’t i just cover you for a while?

q: no-no! no way! joey tribbiani does not take charity…anymore.
a: it’s not charity, joe…

q: no! forget it! okay—i mean thanks, but i’m done taking money from you. all right, i can take of myself. now, what’s next? come on.
a: okay uh, here’s the electric bill. (hands it to him.)

q: this is how much we pay for electric?!!!
a: uh, yeah. so, we’ll do the rest of the bills later then?

q: so is joey going to have to give up the apartment?
a: no, i hope not! i tried to offer him some money, but he wouldn’t take it.

q: well, how much do you think he needs?
a: i figure that $1,500 would cover him for a few months, y’know? but i have to trick him into taking it so i won’t hurt his pride.

q: why don’t you hire him as an actor? you could have him dress up and put on little skits. whatever you want.
a: well that would help the pride thing.

q: (entering from her room) hey!
a: hey! wow! you look great! wanna move in with me tomorrow?

q: (thinks) okay.
a: okay! (they kiss) so, what do you girls have planned for tonight?

q: hey!
a: hey!

q: hey! so you guys have anything planned for the big last night?
a: well, instead of just hanging out, we figure we’d do nothing.

q: (entering and interrupting the guy’s escape attempt) okay! the movers will be here in 11 hours. rachel has not packed. now, everybody has to help! chandler, we’re gonna start with…
a: oh nope, i-i have plans with joey.

q: i thought you said you were going to do nothing.
a: yes, but for the last time.

q: it’s almost 8 o’clock, it’s almost past his bedtime. where-where is he?
a: he’s at a dinner party.

q: here it is! our last pizzas together as roommates.
a: oh, i wish i’d know you were going to do that, i ordered chinese.

q: oh that’s okay. hey, actually in a way it’s kinda nice. me, bringing the food of my ancestors, you, the food of yours!
a: say, joe, i had a strange idea of what we could do for our last night. what do you say we play a little uh, foosball for money?

q: what, are you crazy? you haven’t beaten me once since my injury plagued ’97 season. it would be easier if you just give me your money.
a: yes it would. what do you say to $50?

q: okay, you’re on.
a: okay, let’s play! the big game, italy vs. china, apparently.

q: (scores) yes! i win again! ha-ha! that’s like 500 bucks you owe me! whoo-ho-hoo! (goes over to the fridge and starts opening and closing the door rapidly.) $500 that is a loooot of electricity! (by the way, there’s nothing in the fridge.) whoo-ho-ho! (notices the sparseness of the fridge.) i gotta buy some food.
a: okay, give me a chance to win my money back. okay? sudden death, one goal, $1,000.

q: you serious?
a: oh yes!

q: okay, get ready to owe me!
a: okay.

q: okay, here we go. ready?
a: no! no! no! no—(joey looks at him)—one can beat me. see? now, that’s why only the little fake men are supposed to do all the kicking.

q: yeah, we should get a move on if we wanna make those dinner reservations. (phoebe dumps a drawer full of makeup into a box.)
a: still broken?

q: all right! all right! enough! enough! enough!! enough! (to chandler and monica) you two go home! i-i-i gotta talk to janine! (they start to leave.)
a: (to monica) y’know i think you can take her.

q: (chasing her) you’d better run!

q: yeah uh, what am i gonna do?
a: yeah, i’m sorry man. (pause) you wanna go watch?

q: how ya doin’?

q: well, when it’s not right, you know it.
a: you okay?

q: what?

q: i’m sorry, i was just reading the joke below it. man, that one is funny. (ross grabs the magazine away from her.)

q: no.
a: seriously?

q: look, chandler, it’s my joke. but, hey, if it makes you feel any better they don’t print the name, so it doesn’t really matter who gets credit, right?
a: yeah, i guess.

q: (entering) hey guys.

q: no, it’s my joke, it’s mine. you can call them, they’ll tell you.
a: it’s my joke.

q: whoa-whoa-whoa. jokes? you guys know they have naked chicks in there, right?

q: let’s go watch it at your place.

q: i uh, oh! because, uh, i haven’t really paid the bill
a: if you need money, will you please-please just let me loan you some money?

q: no, chandler. look, forget about it, okay? look, i know things have been a little tight since janine moved out. oh, was she hot.

q: i know! yeah, but, look i can handle it. all right? look, i can listen to the radio, huh? and ross gave me this great book (holds up the playboy magazine).
a: (picks up the phone) all right, you want to see if the joke stealer will let us watch the show at his place?

q: sure.
a: (with phone to ear, obviously hearing no dial tone) paid your phone bill?

q: you forget how many great songs heart had.
a: yeah.

q: you know, barracuda was the first song i learned to play on the keyboard.
a: so, you heard it, you repeated it, so that must mean you wrote it.

q: what, you didn’t get it? the doctor is a monkey.
a: and monkeys can’t write out prescriptions. (stops laughing, to ross) you are not allowed to laugh at my joke.

q: your joke? well, i think ‘the hef’ would disagree, which is why he sent me a check for one hundred ah-dollars.
a: so, you stole my joke, and you stole my money.

q: well, i was going to stick it in the atm, but now i think i’ll show the sexy teller that i am a published writer.

q: oh, what are you going to do, follow me down there?

q: well, i’m not going to go now anyway (he goes to sit down).
a: okay (he goes to sit down).

q: (visibly upset) she picked rachel. i mean, she tried to back out of it, but it was obvious. she picked rachel.

q: it’s wrong. you know what else is wrong? phoebe picking rachel.

q: that’s a good idea.
a: yeah!

q: do you know what’s a bad idea?
a: picking rachel.

q: that’s right. (a noise comes from the living room.) did you hear something?

q: it’s kind of embarrassing, y’know. i mean, i was an actor and now i’m a waiter. it’s supposed to go in the other direction.

a: i think it’s great that you work here. you’re going to make a lot of money, and here’s your first tip: don’t eat yellow snow. (he laughs, then picks up a pen, glares at ross, and writes in his journal). ah ha ha, 2:15, coffeehouse.

q: it’s my joke.
a: it’s my joke.

q: y’know, i don’t think we’re going to settle this.

q: yeah!
a: yeah!

q: hey mon.

q: it’s your joke.

a: what?!

q: yeah.
a: hey.

q: what?! you kissed!

q: oh my god! are-are you crying?
a: (crying hysterically) i just don’t see why those two can’t work things out!

q: bye.
a: (starts crying) i-i can’t believe jill’s gone. (they all look at him.) i can’t help it, i opened a gate.

q: i’d bet i’d still be doing my kara-tay. (that’s karate, he’s just saying it that way.) towards the end of our marriage i was doing a lot of kara-tay as a way of releasing the tension from y’know, not doing anything else physical.
a: maybe the problem was you were pronouncing it kara-tay.

q: and what if i was still fat? (to chandler) well, you wouldn’t be dating me, that’s for sure.

q: (simultaneously) oh yeah! come on! yeah right!
a: what, you guys really think that i’m that shallow?

q: hey, imagine if i never got fired off days of our lives! (closes his eyes to do so.) oh-hey, there’s carol again!
a: what if i had had the guts to quit my job? i’d probably be writing for the new yorker, getting paid to be funny. but my job’s fun too! i mean tomorrow, i-i don’t have to wear a tie.

q: oh dear god, let me think. (starts to sarcastically think about it.)
a: (entering, depressed) hey.

q: oh no! what’s the matter?
a: oh i just got another rejection letter. they said my writing was funny, just not "archie comic funny."

q: bye-bye. (gets up to leave.) oh uh, by the way, the answer is, the brazil nut. (exits.)
a: was his question what’s more boring than him?

q: hey man, look sorry about that archie thing. do uh, do you need me to give you some money?
a: hey, i may have no money, but i still have my pride.

q: really?
a: ehh.

q: that’s great! that would be great! let’s do that!
a: i could use the money; it could give me time to write.

q: oh right great! welcome aboard!
a: okay!

q: all right! now hey, i need to use the bathroom. since i don’t need any assistance in there, take a break!
a: all right!

q: and, and uh, you-you remember my friend chandler. (points to him.)
a: hey.

q: (stunned) you are friends with dr. drake remoray?
a: well it’s kinda hard to be friends with drake because of his busy schedule and the fact that he’s not real.

q: (entering) hey there you are!
a: uh-oh, it’s my boss!

q: all right, here’s a list of things for you to do today. man, this going to be so great! thank you so much! all right, i got to go to work i’m delivering twins today, but only one of them is mine! (exits.)
a: (reading the list) drop off my dry cleaning. pick up my vitamins. teach me how to spell vitamins. wear in my new jeans.

q: (laughs) you realize what you are don’t you?
a: what?

q: no! there-there was a little, a little diff in the market and i lost 13 million dollars.
a: but the kit-kats are all right?!

q: (louder) my chest hurts! oh, and now i-i can’t breathe.
a: phoebe, are you having a heart attack?!

q: honey, having a heart attack is nature’s way of telling you to slow it down.
a: i always thought having a heart attack was nature’s way of telling you to die! (phoebe glares at him.) but you’re not gonna die. i mean, you are going to die, but you’re not gonna die today. i wish i was dead.

q: sorry. so how’s it going with joey?
a: oh just great. he beeps me now with codes. one is, "bring me food." two is, "i’m with a girl, bring us food." three is, "i’m lost and i can’t find food."

q: okay, you watch too much tv.
a: (approaching) here you go joe, here’s the freshly squeezed orange juice you asked for. (hands it to him.)

q: thanks! (looks at it.) yeah, there’s pulp in that. (hands it back.)
a: yeah?

q: i thought we talked about this. i don’t like pulp. no pulp. pulp isn’t juice. all juice, okay?
a: i’m sorry, i guess i just like the pulp.

q: i cannot believe you guys! he was really nice and he left because of you!
a: yeah, but sebastian? what is that? a cat’s name?

q: all right.
a: okay, so you will meet our guys?

q: yes, i’ll meet ‘em.
a: okay now it doesn’t matter which one you choose, y’know? it’s completely up to you. our guy is perfect, or you can go out with the guy phoebe deemed not good enough to go out with herself.

q: okay.
a: (to ross) well, there you are! so what did elizabeth say?

q: man, she is going to have a great time! is she staying at the hotel corona?
a: you know the hotels?

q: well, what is she goes down and-and sleeps with a bunch of guys?
a: well, maybe you don’t marry this one.

q: hey!
a: good-good-good-good.

q: hey!
a: hey!

q: i don’t know. i know i don’t work late tomorrow night.
a: tomorrow night is good. tomorrow night is good, but uh, y’know what? why put off something till tomorrow that you can do right now? (laughs) eldad come here! (he stands up from the next table.)

q: well-well a little blind sided but y’know good.
a: eldad, sit down. (to rachel) move over! move over now!

q: i—ohh! (moves over and lets eldad sit on the couch.)
a: there you go! there you are! (rachel stares at monica and chandler)

q: hi.
a: hi. (to phoebe) okay, you’re too late okay? because she’s already with our guy.

q: rachel! rachel! you haven’t touched eldad’s hair!
a: it is the softest hair! touch it! (both he and monica do so.)

q: that’s right patrick, bye-bye!
a: (to rachel) eldad is much more cooperative! and he can dance! (to eldad) you dance for rachel!

q: oh that’s all right! y’know, i ended up having a really good time. y’know, the charity was a big success and they raised a lot of money and awareness.
a: so what was it for anyway?

q: ahh, to be 13 again.
a: yeah.

q: (tremendously overacting) fine! i’ll do it without you! (joey gives her thumbs up) i don’t need you or anybody else! i’m gonna make it on my own! (joey closes the door to his bedroom.) you’ll see!! you’ll all see!!
a: (to joey) so uh, what’s this thing you’re auditioning for?

q: that’s the title! yeah! y’know they really lucked out that the initials spell cheese.
a: that is lucky.

q: well, don’t get your hopes up, because probably not gonna happen.
a: now-now, why would you say that joseph?

q: ugh, how can you even ask that question?!
a: whoa, she's pretty. (mentioning the girl on tv)

q: it's like, you got so many lines to learn so fast, that sometimes you need a minute to remember your next one. so while you're thinkin' of it, you take this big pause where you look all intense, you know, like this. (does this intense look where it looks like he's smelling a fart.)
a: oh, ok.

q: c'mon, you guys. this is a real movie, and al pacino's in it, and that's big!
a: oh no, it's terrific, it's- it's- y'know, you deserve this, after all your years of struggling, you've finally been able to crack your way into show business.

q: it’s your turn.
a: oh, are we playing this?!

q: (entering, dejectedly) hey.
a: hey! how’d the audition go?

q: totally!
a: so it did go well.

q: great!
a: oh that’s great!

q: yeah-yeah, it’s down to me and two other guys.
a: oh my god!

q: oh, i love that guy! (laughs.)
a: oh-oh, what are you doing?

q: i’m just so nervous! y’know? the callback isn’t until tomorrow at five. i feel like my head is going to explode!
a: well, it is overdue.

q: yeah, none of us have to deal with pressure at our jobs.
a: (on phone) yes, fran. i know what time it is, but i'm looking at the wenus and i'm not happy!

q: i want this part so much! y’know? if i don’t get this part i’m never gonna eat macaroni and cheese again!—no, i didn’t say that! that’s a lie.
a: oh come on guys, it’s not like i moved to europe! i just moved across the hall! and we would have you over all the time if it weren’t for (struggles to get this out) monica’s allergies. (the duck quacks.) you’re right, i could never lie to you. she hates you. (the phone rings.) should i get that? (laughs, then answers the phone.) hello? (listens) uh no, joey’s not here right now. can i take a message? (listens) yeah, okay so the audition has been moved from 5:00 to 2:30? (listens) okay great. (listens.) bye. (hangs up the phone and goes to write the message on the magna-doodle on the door but monica walks in and forces him to jump out of the way.)

q: (startled) ahh! aren’t you dressed yet?
a: (looks down at his clothes) am i naked again?!

q: we’re supposed to meet my parents in 15 minutes.
a: yeah okay, i was just talking to the guys. just look at them i mean, is it okay if they come visit?

q: wh?! what about my allergies?!
a: oh right, your allergies. (monica leaves and to the chick and duck) all her, she hates you. (chandler leaves without finishing the message for joey.)

q: yes!! ha-ha!! all right! hey! how cool would it be if you could watch like a real life-sized version of this? huh? i mean how crazy would that be?
a: as crazy as soccer?

q: (on phone) hello? (listens) what are you talking about? the audition’s not ‘til 5:00! (chandler suddenly remembers and looks at the unfinished message then tries to sneak over and finish it as joey listens.) well, nobody told me! (listens) who’d you talk to? (listens and turns around to see chandler trying to finish the message.) nevermind! (hangs up.)
a: you mean you didn’t get it from this?

q: the allergy guy got the part! thanks!
a: well, maybe we can fix it y’know? maybe we can send him some-some big-big flowers and scare him!

q: how could you do this to me chandler?! this part could’ve turned my whole career around!
a: i messed up. okay? i’m sorry, i really messed up.

q: hey, you don’t even live here anymore! what are you doing answering my phone? i have my machine!
a: which i bought for ya. taught ya how to use it. you thought it was a copier. look, if there was anything i could do, i would do it. okay? but everybody’s allowed one mistake, right? you know he coulda gotten me a vcr, he coulda gotten me a set of golf clubs, but no, he has to get me the woman repeller!  the eyesore from the liberace house of crap!

q: it's not that bad.
a: oh, yeah, easy for you to say, you don't have to walk around sporting some reject from the mr. t collection. [joey walks in behind chandler]

q: chandler, chandler.
a: i pity the fool who puts on my jewelry, i do, i do. i pity the fool that. . . [turns around and sees joey] hi! yeah, i mean when you were late last night, kathy and i got to talking, and one thing to another and…

q: and what?! did you sleep with her?!
a: no! no! no! i just kissed her.

q: what?!! that’s even worse!!
a: how is that worse?!

q: i don’t know! but it’s the same!
a: you’re right, i have no excuses! i was totally over the line.

q: over the line?! you-you’re-you’re so far past the line, that you-you can’t even see the line! the line is a dot to you!
a: look, i’m not saying that you should magically forgive me! but you’re not perfect! you’ve made some errors in judgment too!

q: name one!
a: (lets him out) what happened?!!

q: (getting out) awww, man! he promised he wouldn’t take the chairs!!
a: what the hell happened?!! how were you locked in?!! and where the hell is all of our stuff?!!

q: well, this guy came by to look at the unit and-and he said he didn’t think big enough to fit a grown man!
a: so--you got in voluntarily?!

q: i was tryin’ to make a sale!! oh, man, if i ever run into that guy again, do you know what i’m gonna do?
a: bend over?!!! ok, now, remember, no trading. you get the pretty one, i get the mess.

q: hi, joey. (sees chandler.) well well, look what you brought.
a: ...and what did you bring?

q: she's checking the coats. joey, i'm gonna go wash the cab smell off my hands. will you get me a white zinfandel, and a glass of red for janice.
a: janice? janice?!

q: oh.... my.... god.
a: joey's tailor...took advantage of me.

q: no way!  i've been going to the guy for 12 years.
a: oh come on!  he said he was going to do my inseam, and he ran his hand up my leg, and then, there was definite...

q: what?
a: cupping.

q: i said name one!
a: i can’t believe i did this! what an idiot!

q: oh, stop beating yourself up! people make mistakes! these things happen! there aren’t any message you’ve forgotten to give me are there? (chandler has a disgusted look on his face.) apparently you’re not very good at it! i…
a: do you think he’ll ever forgive me?

q: of course he will! but chandler the most important thing is you forgive yourself!
a: y’know what? i-i kinda have.

q: y’know what? he will forgive you. and i like to bring a pad with me when i go answer the phone just in case… (chandler gets that disgusted look back.) okay…
a: you didn’t see how mad he was, y’know?

q: and hey! just so you know, it’s not that common! it doesn’t happen to every guy! and it is a big deal!!
a: (coming out from behind the door) i knew it!!!!

q: okay, buddy-boy. here it is. you hide my clothes, i'm wearing everything you own.
a: oh my god!

q: look at me! i'm chandler! could i be wearing any more clothes? maybe if i wasn't going commando... yeah. whew, it's hot with all of this stuff on. i ah, i better not do any, i don't know, lunges. (starts doing lunges)
a: joey? got you a joey special, two pizzas! joe? (the phone rings and he answers it) (on phone) hello? (takes the phone away from his mouth when he realizes what he just did and yells.) damnit! (back on phone.) hello? (listens.) no, joey’s not here right now, but i can take a message i think. (listens) he’s still got a chance for the part?! oh, that’s great news! (listens) well no obviously not for the actor who was mauled by his dog. (listens) oh well, that’s great. i will give joey the message. thank you! (hangs up and goes to write the message on the magna-doodle.) yes! (reading what he’s writing) okay, mac audition at 2:00. allergy actor attacked. (pause) by dog not flowers.

q: hey!
a: please tell me you got the message!

q: what message?
a: the actor playing mac couldn’t do it, they needed to see you at 2 o’clock.

q: what?! it’s 6 o’clock!
a: du-du-i wrote it, i wrote it on the board! i wrote it on the board, then i went all over new york city looking for ya! i went to ross’s! i went to the coffeehouse! i went to any place that they made sandwiches!

q: i can’t believe this chandler!
a: sorry! i-i-i don’t know what to say.

q: well you-you-you-you might say congratulations! i saw the board! i went to the audition! i got the part!!
a: (angrily) is that supposed to be funny! i was really worried over here!

q: oh, well i’m uh…
a: y’know, sometimes that fake out thing is just mean!

q: oh wow! okay man, i’m sorry. i did not mean to make you feel bad.
a: well that’s good. because you didn’t! and i’m incredibly happy for ya!!

q: (shocked) that’s mean! you really had me going there!
a: oh, we could do this all day.

q: yeah, you’re right. okay look, listen, let’s talk about what a huge star i’m gonna be!
a: you are gonna be a huge star! i’m gonna hug ya!

q: you hug me!
a: all right!

q: hey, do we do this too much?
a: i think so. yeah, get off me.

q: okay, chandler!
a: okay.

q: and your horoscope says, "on the fifth a special someone is going to give you a gift."
a: (to monica) oh, well thank you in advance. (kisses her.)

q: (entering) hey guys!
a: hey!!

q: (ecstatic) oh my god! it’s joey tribbiani of mac and c.h.e.e.s.e.!!!!!!!
a: oh that’s right. it’s your first day! so are you psyched to fight fake crime with your robot sidekick?

q: (in a sexy voice to chandler) i’ll be waiting.
a: are you judging them by their covers? because you’re really not supposed to do that.

q: (entering) hey!
a: hey!

q: (continuing) i just found out that elizabeth’s dad wants to meet me.
a: wait a minute, hold the phone! you’re not elizabeth’s dad?!

q: ross!!
a: ross!

q: (obviously attracted to him) is-is-is there a-a mrs. stevens?
a: there’s a mr. bing!

q: oh, you don’t have to do that every time.
a: but uh ross, ross is a great guy! i was roommates with him in college. uh, funny story… (he starts laughing then notices that paul isn’t happy.) you’re roommate in college died didn’t he?

q: (returning with the coffee) okay here we are paul, elizabeth. (he sets down their cups.) so i hope you guys were finding something to talk about.
a: yes, we were just…

q: oh! ross is sooo great!
a: hey honey, you got the kind with the little girl, you said we were gonna to get the kind with the baby.

q: no, you said the baby creeps you out.
a: no, the little girl creeps me out.

q: you said the baby.
a: why would the baby creep me out?

q: (writing frantically) you guys, i’m sorry, could you please talk a little slower?
a: this is going in your book?

q: hey!
a: hey!

q: pretty great! except i did get a little attitude from the robot.
a: damn those robots, they’re supposed to be our faithful servants!

q: that’s not a bad idea. yeah. okay, but if i got to turn on the charm tomorrow i’m not wasting anymore of it over here with you guys. (starts to leave, but stops and turns to phoebe.) well, actually i got a little bit saved for you pheebs. (exits.)
a: so do you think uh, joey’s more charming than me?

q: yeah! that’s why i’m sleeping with him on the side.
a: yeah, you wish. (stops to think about it and gets depressed.)

q: i’m not writing about you! i’m writing about other people.
a: who?

q: okay fine! fine! then you know what, i’ll just write about phyllis! hmm!
a: hmm.

q: (writing on a piece of paper) phyllis is sitting in a chair.
a: oh.

q: (still writing) phyllis sees what i’m doing.
a: oh-oh.

q: chandler, we said we would meet at the coffeehouse at six.
a: we said seven!

q: we said six!
a: the only way that i said six would be if the seven’s, let meet at seven, not at six.

q: (turning around in the chair) hi!
a: oh my good god.

q: i know what time you said.
a: what?!

q: quite an interesting turn of events, suddenly it’s my book to the rescue, huh? (reading her book) ooh, very interesting. yeah, well this certainly clears things up.
a: (disgusted) what does it say?!

q: i will tell you as soon as you thank me for writing my book.
a: thank you for writing your book. its-its uh, great book and you are the queen of everything.

q: thanks! so are you.
a: (to monica) i told you i should not wear this color. (he’s wearing a reddish-orange sweater.)

q: (reading from her book) mon… (pause as she restarts) marcia and chester are planning on seeing a movie on sunday night. marcia thinks they’re supposed to meet at six, chester thinks it’s at seven.
a: so you knew we were gonna miss the movie!

q: i can’t believe i’m going to lose this job!
a: oh i’m so sorry man! is there anything i can do?

q: yeah? well, i don’t want to talk to you wayne! i hate you! you ruined my life! oh, chandler, wayne. wayne, chandler. (they shake hands.)
a: hi, how are ya?

q: (incredulous) why should i help you?!
a: (whispering in joey’s ear) the reason he just said.

q: yeah. her. all of them. anyone.
a: yeah, i’ve been there my friend.

q: (dejected) hi, you guys.
a: hey!

q: no! no! it’s just that he gave me three tickets and there are six of us!
a: i’ll give up my ticket.

q: okay that’s so generous!
a: and i think ross is generous too.

q: hi!
a: hey!

q: okay, okay. uh, well uh, rachel is going to need to yell sweet nothings (paul enters) in his ear.
a: ross.

q: (to rachel) thank you, it’s my mom’s. so this is the kitchen.
a: (on machine) you’ve reached monica and chandler’s, if you’re listening to this message, we’re probably screening. (to himself) yeah we are.

q: (on phone) hi, this is heldi from the morgan chase museum. i’m calling for monica geller. i want to let her know that there was a cancellation and if she’s still interested in having the bing-geller wedding at our facility, it is available… (chandler runs to answer the phone.)
a: (on phone) this is chandler bing! this is chandler bing! (listens) yes, the groom—no! not the groom!!

q: hi, honey.
a: (gets up) see you later. (starts to leave.)

q: what? i-i bought groceries, i was gonna make you dinner!
a: (angrily) well next time ask! or at least wait for me to ask! (he storms out.)

q: oh please, he didn’t hear it! he didn’t hear it!!
a: (on machine) this is chandler bing! this is chandler bing! (the machine beeps off.)

q: (going over to him) i’m so sorry. please, stop freaking out.
a: i’m not freaking out. why would i be freaking out? a woman named heldi called and said we were getting married, but that happens everyday. (does one of those chandler noises.)

q: honey, we were at this beautiful place, and i-i-i just put our names down for fun! i mean, what’s the harm in that?
a: right here! (clucks like a chicken for some reason.)

q: chandler, please don’t think i was trying to pressure you. phoebe and rachel…
a: phoebe and rachel! so the people that knew about our wedding before me were you, phoebe and rachel, heldi, and apparently some band called starlight magic 7 who are available by the way!

q: it was a mistake. please don’t take this to mean anything, because it doesn’t.
a: okay.

q: really?
a: yes, if it really doesn’t mean anything, because you know that i’m just not ready…

q: i know! i know.
a: okay. (they hug.)

q: (entering from her room) hey, did she buy it?
a: totally.

q: so did heldi show you the place?
a: yeah, it’s beautiful.

q: i can’t believe you’re gonna ask monica to marry you!
a: i know.

q: great! (takes his coffee and leaves.)
a: pheebs, can you help me pick out an engagement ring for monica? i can’t figure this out! it’s so hard! should i get her a (turning to each page) tiffany cut or a princess cut or a—ah-ah! paper cut!

q: now, have you told anyone else?
a: no, i don’t want to tell anybody else because i don’t want monica to find out.

q: you told me.
a: well, it’s because i trust you, you’re one of my best friends, and you walked in on me when i was looking at ring brochures.

q: yeah well, once again not knocking pays off. i only wish you hadn’t been on the toilet.
a: me too.

q: hey. (heads straight for the fridge.)
a: hey.

q: hey! so chandler, wanna go to the coffeehouse?
a: oh all right.

q: oh perfect, we were just gonna see if you wanted to go.
a: oh well, we don’t because we got…the…other pl-place.

q: my god, i’m sorry! i’m sorry! i didn’t mean to do that! i wouldn’t do that!
a: nothin! this is the nine millionth ring store we’ve been too and i can’t find the perfect ring! (goes over to another display counter and starts pointing at rings.) ugly ring! ugly ring! ugly ring! (notices that one of the jewelers is watching him.) it’s a beautiful selection. (the jeweler walks away slowly.)

q: okay, so maybe you don’t get her a ring. maybe you-maybe you do something different. y’know? maybe you get her an engagement bracelet, y’know? or an engagement tiara? or—ooh! an engagement revolutionary war musket! (picks one up from the display in the corner.
a: y’know, i’m so glad i picked you to help me with this.

q: huh? can you just imagine getting down on one knee and handing her this gorgeous piece of weaponry?
a: yeah, i’m gonna stick with the ring. (goes to another display counter.) oh, this one’s nice! (pointing to another ring.) i like this one! sir? uh, kind sir? can i see this one?

q: can i help you?
a: uh-uh, yes. i would like to see that ring please.

q: this ring is from the 1920s, it’s a one and a half carat diamond with sapphires on either side.
a: sir, can i ask you to umm, could you…hold out that ring and ask me to marry you?

q: okay. (holds out the ring, deadpan.) will you marry me?
a: (choking up) oh my god that’s it, that’s the ring! how much is it?

q: (angrily) are you interested in this ring?!
a: yes! yes, but i can only pay $8,000.

q: (ignoring her) how would you like to pay?
a: uh, credit card. (reaches for it then realizes) oh no! no-no, but i left my credit card with joey. (to phoebe) okay, i’ll go get it. you guard the ring.

q: rachel?
a: no. how are ya paul? (starts to look for his credit card.)

q: (acting manly to try and cover up his crying) okay. chandler, did your dad ever hug you?
a: no, did he hug you?!

q: no! no! it’s just that, my dad never did. i miss my dad.
a: well, you can see my dad in vegas kissing other dads.

q: hey chandler?
a: yeah?

q: would you…….would you hug me?
a: i’m a little busy here paul.

q: that’s exactly what my dad used to say! (starts to breakdown again.)
a: okay, a quick one. come on hug it out. (paul rushes over and hugs chandler tightly.) oh hey! there you go. (the hug continues.) okay. (the hug continues.)

q: five more seconds.
a: okay! (pushes him away.)

q: whoa-whoa-hey-hey! (motions to chandler, "what’s going on?") hi, paul is it? (paul nods yes and still hugging joey.)
a: do you have my credit card?

q: yes, it’s in my… in…in my pocket. (paul hasn’t dropped him yet.) (chandler starts to reach for his front pocket.) my back pocket! my back pocket!
a: thank god! (grabs his card.)

q: oh hey listen i got us tickets to a knicks game tonight.
a: oh, i can’t go.

q: chandler, i found the perfect ring. (holding it out for her.)
a: oh, that’s uh, that’s pretty nice but i’m gonna go with the one i picked first.

q: oh my god chandler, the one you picked is gone. it’s over!
a: what?

q: some guy bought it. i’m sorry. i tired to stop it but they (points to the jeweler) put me in jail!
a: they put you in jail?

q: the little jail between the doors!
a: phoebe, i asked you to guard the ring!

q: i know, i’m sorry! but y’know, this ring is better! monica never even saw the other ring.
a: yeah but when he proposed to me with the ring i got goose bumps.

q: maybe it was the guy.
a: it was the ring!

q: (entering from her room) hey.
a: i can’t believe i let you talk me into buying this stupid gumball machine looking ring!

q: it’s not a stupid gumball machine looking ring! it’s a beautiful ring!
a: no, it’s not! when i looked at the other ring i could see monica’s face when i gave it to her, y’know? and i could see her saying yes. when i look at this ring, all i see is a ring! unless i look at it really closely and then i can see my own eye. (does so and laughs.) look, this is the most important thing i’m gonna do in my life. i wanna make sure it’s perfect.

q: okay. there may be a way that we can get the other ring back. ‘cause i heard the guy tell the jeweler where he was going to propose. so maybe we can get him to trade rings or something.
a: i can’t do that.

q: well you certainly can’t give her that stupid gumball ring. there he is! (points.)
a: okay and he hasn’t proposed yet because she has no ring on her finger.

q: wow! you’re good! after this, we should solve crimes.
a: yeah! okay, go, go, go get him.

q: (to chandler) here he is.
a: (to him) hi! hi. okay, there was a slight mix-up at the jewelry store, the ring you’re about to propose with was supposed to be held for me. so, i’m gonna need to have that back. (the guy isn’t sure.) but, in exchange i’m willing to trade you this beautiful, more expensive ring. (looking at the ring.) ew.

q: it is beautiful, but i’m gonna use this one. now, if you’ll excuse me.
a: no-no! this is my fiancee (phoebe) and her heart was set on that ring. you don’t want to break her heart now do you?

q: you’re dying?!
a: yeah, she’s dying… of a cough apparently.

q: yes, and it is my dying wish to have that ring. see, if i’m not buried with that ring then my spirit is going to wander the nether world for all eternity…
a: (interrupting her) okay, that’s enough honey!

q: i don’t know. (pause) let me see the ring.
a: great! okay, here. (holds the ring up for him.)

q: (looks at it) all right. (exchanges rings.)
a: thank you. thank you. thank you! (to his girlfriend) and you are about to marry a wonderful man! (she stunned and he’s horrified.) hey! i’m marrying a dead woman! guys? (they ignore him.) i’ve got something important to tell ya. (still nothing so he walks over and stands in front of the tv.) guys? (they lean over to try and watch the tv, chandler mimics them.) guys?! (pause) i’m gonna ask monica to marry me.

q: wait a minute, is this, is this for real?
a: yeah, check out the ring. (shows it to them.)

q: so you two are really serious?!
a: yep, pretty much.

q: and-and-and-and-and-and, and we’re gonna be friends again!
a: (goes to hug him and stops short) heyyyy—what?

q: oh it’s water under the bridge, forget it!
a: okay! (they hug.) i was gonna wait ‘til uh, it was official y’know? but i got so excited i just had to tell you guys because you’re my best friends.

q: (who has just entered) ugh! no more crying! please! i just dumped one cry baby, i’ll dump you too!
a: i’m gonna ask monica to marry me.

(it’s a butchered version of the pledge of allegiance of the united states for our foreign friends.) the champagne is here. (the waiter is delivering it and pouring two glasses.)

q: are you okay?

a: hi.

q: hey!
a: hey!

q: yeah, but that’s pigs not people!
a: if marriage worked, i’d be all for it. but do you know what the divorce rate in this country is? 97%.

q: wait a minute. are you honestly telling me that-that you may never want to get married?
a: well, never say never but y’know probably uh yeah, never.

q: oh my god! then-then-then what are we even doing?! what is this?!
a: whoa! whoa! whoa! what is all this pressure?! is this some new kind of strategy? why don’t you put down your copy of ‘the rules’ huh mantrap?!

q: y’know what?! i gotta go! ugh!
a: (to them) it’s okay, i got a plan.

a: my—oh my god!

q: i know! they suck!!
a: he’s not supposed to ask my girlfriend to marry him! i’m supposed to do that!

q: i know!
a: well what… y’know what i’m gonna do? i’m gonna go over there; i’m gonna kick his ass! (pause) will you help me?!

q: look, chandler i don’t think us getting our asses kicked is a solution. okay? just go and find monica!
a: you’re right.

q: yeah!
a: okay. (starts running for the bedroom) i’m gonna get the ring! i’m gonna get the ring! (does so) i’m gonna go find her and (starts running for the door) i’m just going to propose!

q: okay.
a: okay great.

q: dude-dude-dude!

q: well if it helps, it worked very well.

(sits down heavily.) i was gonna propose tonight.

q: you were gonna propose? (sits on the arm of the couch.)
a: yeah i even (pause) got a ring. (puts in on the center cushion.) did you get a ring?

(starting to cry again.) and if you’ll let me, i will spend the rest of my life trying to make you feel the same way. (pause as he gets out the ring.) monica, will you marry me?

q: what?

q: you-you’re gonna have to put your foot down?

q: hey.

q: you do?!
a: yeah, i’m putting my foot down. yeah look, when i proposed i told you that i would do anything to make you happy, and if having the perfect wedding makes you happy then, then that’s what we’re gonna do.

q: oh, you’re so sweet. (they hug and kiss.) oh, but wait, what about our, what about the future and stuff?

q: you thought about that?

q: how many kids were we gonna have?

a: well, stuff like where’d we live, y’know? like a small place outside the city, where our kids could learn to ride their bikes and stuff. y’know, we could have a cat that had a bell on it’s collar and we could hear it every time it ran through the little kitty door. of course, we’d have an apartment over the garage where joey could grow old.

q: (laughs) y’know what? i-i don’t want a big, fancy wedding.
a: sure you do.

q: no, i want everything you just said. i want a marriage.

q: uh-hmm.
a: i love you so much.

q: i don’t want to, i’m scared.
a: hey, you guys!

q: hey!
a: so, what do you think?

q: what?

q: eyes! no, no. your eyes! no. chandler’s eyes!
a: i got glasses!

q: well, you-you’ve always had glasses.

q: yes!
a: no!

q: sweetie, i think the glasses look great. they make you look really sexy.
a: really?

q: yeah!
a: (sitting down on the arm of her chair) you didn’t think i used to wear glasses, right?

q: so what do you guys want for an engagement present?

a: our kids are gonna be fat aren’t they.

a: hey! how’s the boat?!
