a: okay, it's just that dogs make me a little uncomfortable.

q: (to phoebe) it hurts my teeth.
a: and i don't wanna say this, i don't you guys to hate me, but uh, i don't think, i can be around that dog anymore. okay, so either the dog goes, or i go. (an awkward silence ensues.) oh my god!!

q: where's chandler?
a: (comes out of the bathroom) here i am.

q: wash your hands!!!
a: how did you…know? (heads back into the bathroom)

q: see, this is exactly what we do not have time for. (she rushes into her room)
a: (comes out of the bathroom) where's monica?

q: um, in phoebe's room. you can't go in there.
a: why not?

q: monica's crying. she's very upset about this whole clunkers thing.
a: well, i, i should go in there.

q: no. no, no. she doesn't want to see you right now.
a: why not?

q: because you sent away the dog!
a: this is ridiculous. (he heads for phoebe's bedroom)

q: (entering) okay, i'm in my sweat pants. bring on the food! (sees that chandler has a worried look on his face) what's the matter?
a: monica's all upset, because i sent clunkers away.

q: so? bring the dog back, you're a hero.
a: yeah, i can be a hero, i could do that. i could, i could do... i, w-w-what if, what if it attacks me?

q: chandler, it's like a big gerbil.
a: and that doesn't scare you? (he walks out)

q: (opens her bedroom door and peeks out) hey, is chandler here?
a: no, no he went for a walk.

q: hi, honey.
a: please, please, please, don't be mad at me.

q: (interrupts her, to monica) shh, wait and see. maybe we will, maybe we won't.
a: okay, i went over to ross' apartment to bring back clunkers. y’know, for you, and…(clears his throat) i left the door open and she must have gotten out and i looked everywhere, all over the apartment, including the roof, which fyi ross, one of your neighbors, growing weed. i couldn't find him, and i am so, so, so, sorry. but i do know where we could all go ease the pain. (points up and then over to the street)

q: (uncovers the dog) hi!
a: clunkers?! oh my god!

q: it's a thanksgiving miracle!
a: (to clunkers) it is so good to see you!

q: okay, maybe this is so hard, because there aren't 50 states. let me tell you something, i have 49 states, and there are no more! i-i think, i should be able to eat something.
a: it's up to you.

q: delaware! (starting to cry.) delaware!
a: all right.

q: (hands chandler his pad and walks in) i want my turkey now!
a: you got it. (starts looking at the pad, while ross got the turkey out of the fridge and starts to unwrap and it) you got nevada twice.

q: (pauses) i know.
a: yeah. (throws the pad on the table and heads for the bedroom)

q: uh-huh!
a: okay, let me just straighten out your helmet there. (does so.)

q: no-no, one daddy, two mommies. all right, it’s all yours. (ross pushes him off.)
a: okay. okay.

q: well, we didn’t have a lot of money. but the girl across the street had the best bike! it was pink and it had rainbow colored tassels hanging off the handle grips, and-and-and a bell and this big, white wicker basket with those plastic daisies stuck on.
a: that sounds like my first bike. (they all turn and look at him.) my dad gave me his old one.

q: not really, i got to drag him around too! (they all nod, "oh.")
a: hey! what are you guys doing?

q: making holiday candy for the neighbors.
a: i’m sorry, who?

q: i’m gonna hang this basket (points to the one sitting on the table) on the door and when the neighbors walk by they can all take a piece.
a: but we don’t know the neighbors.

q: see? this is exactly why i’m making this candy. we can learn their names and get to know our neighbors.
a: wouldn’t it be easier if we just moved?

q: (entering, happily) gooood morning!!
a: eh, somebody’s in a good mood!

q: the basket is totally empty! my god, the neighbors ate all the candy!
a: well, either that or uh…(motions towards joey’s door.)

q: (starts to leave, but stops) oh and chandler’s about to cry.
a: (about to cry) am not!

q: (turning a light on) who is that?!
a: don’t worry, i’m brave! i am brave! i…i am brave! (they get to the door and monica goes to open it.) no-no-no-no!! (he stops her.) (through the door.) can you tell me who is there please?

q: oh please! (to chandler) did you hear that? little drops of heaven.
a: (laughs) 4:00 a.m.

q: so, can i get some candy?
a: i am sorry, but some of us have to get up early and go to work! (monica looks at him) (to monica) he does not know that i am not some of us.

q: (looking at monica.) mm! seems like i would’ve remembered you!
a: mm! night gar’! (monica closes the door.)

q: almost cried huh? hear that chandler? almost cried!
a: hey, you cry every time somebody talks about titanic!

q: oh hi!
a: hey! so are you enjoying the bike?

q: see, this is why i told you never get involved with your assistant! and here is no such thing as keeping secrets when it comes to affairs. (to chandler) did you hear that chandler? no such thing!
a: (with his mouth full) what happened? i’m just eating candy.

q: maybe it’s not as bad as i think. y’know, maybe they didn’t take it the way i meant it.
a: absolutely! y’know, because touchie can mean both ass and good worker.

q: oh my god! joey!
a: what is the matter with you?

q: (watching the discussion) hey chandler, do we know that lady?
a: maybe, isn’t she the woman who lives below you and has sex really loud?

q: (closing the door) it’s unbelievable! i-i can’t believe that sign didn’t work!
a: y’know what would work?

q: hmm?
a: stop making candy!

q: but they like it!
a: you mean they like you.

q: maybe.
a: is that why you became a chef? so that people would like you?

q: (looking at his butt) there it is. (they hug.)
a: (asking a man leaning against the wall) what is going on?

q: yeah lady! give us candy!!
a: joey!

q: what’s up buddy?
a: what are you doing?

q: waiting for candy.
a: get in here! (they head for the door and chandler sees smokes-a-lot lady standing next to the door and smoking, to her) hey, and you can not smoke in here! (takes the cigarette and takes a drag for himself.) (exhaling in ecstasy) merry christmas.

q: we want candy! we want candy now! (and other general commotion sounds.)
a: all right everybody! just be quiet! be quiet! be quiet!! pipe-pipe-pipe down! (they settle down) what is the matter with you people?! this woman was trying to do a nice thing for you. she was making candy so she could try to get to know all of you, and i’ll bet that not one of you can tell me her name! am i right?

q: (from earlier) candy lady?
a: no not (imitating) candy lady.

q: (stepping in and knocking the man over) hey, if we know it can we have candy?!!
a: all right, y’know what? forget it, all of you forget it! you’ve ruined it! go home! you’ve ruined it! you’ve ruined it!

q: (to chandler) thank you.
a: you’re welcome. (they kiss.)

q: did you smoke?
a: no! smokes-a-lot lady blew smoke directly into my mouth. eh-uh—are you okay?

q: don’t be so corny ross, it’s not an after-school special. (she rides off and the camera pans down to reveal two shiny, silver training wheels firmly attached.)
a: buh-bye. (hangs up the phone) i just got us reservations at michelle’s and tickets to the musicman to celebrate our first holiday season as a betroughed couple.

q: betrothed… (corrects him)
a: …betrothed couple.

q: (entering carrying a skull) hey!
a: hey!

q: haaaa... (puts the skull on the table) ... ahhhh!
a: pheebs?

q: huh?
a: skull?

q: no.
a: how long have we been home?

q: about a half an hour.
a: lovely! hey, you know what i was thinking? when we get married, are you gonna change your last name to bing?

q: no.
a: why not?

q: (entering) oh, hey, you guys!
a: hey!

q: yes, you will be very sad. all right, well i gotta go tell rachel the good news.
a: ohh! you guys gonna be living together again?

q: yeah, why not?
a: well, she's just so much fun with joey, i just assumed, she'd still be living with him.

q: why do you think, she's having so much fun living with joey?
a: no reason, except…she…told…me.

q: really? so she said, she didn’t wanna live with me anymore?
a: no! no, she didn't say that. i-i-i think you should talk to monica now.

q: probably? yeah, i don't like that word. (chandler and monica look surprised) kind of what ‘probably’ really means. yeah, uh-huh. yeah, oh, "your mom probably won't kill herself," y’know? i'm sorry, but i'm not hanging all my hopes of rachel and i living together on-on "probably!" y’know? you gotta take care of yourselves! (she starts to walk out) in this world history teaches us nothing! (exits)
a: bing doesn't seem so weird now, does it?

q: (yelling) no! drums!
a: (to the maitre d') hi, could we get two burritos to go, please? (laughs.)

q: oh-kay, we'll have a table for you in about 45 minutes.
a: forty-five minutes? we have tickets to the musicman at 8:00.

q: i'm sorry. christmas is a very busy time, sir.
a: is this because of the burrito thing?

q: (pulling chandler away from the maitre d') you need to give him money.
a: give him money? it was a joke!

q: no, to get a table! places like are always shakin’ you down. everybody wants to be paid off.
a: right, calm down, o'mally. i'll slip him some money.

q: you've got to be smooth about it.
a: hey, i can be smooth. (walks back to the maitre d', very smoothly) listen, we're a little bit in a hurry, so, if you can get us a table a little quicker, i'd appreciate it. (shakes his hand)

q: of course, sir.
a: okay. (walks back to monica)

q: how did it go?
a: had the money in the wrong hand. (shows her his left hand with the money in it)

q: it's easy! just keep it casual! give him a kind word, shake his hand and give him the money!
a: how do you know so much about this?

q: i don't know.
a: richard used to do it, didn't he?

q: we'd be eating our soup right now.
a: mustached bastard…

q: (sees two people exit) okay, those people just left, come on! quick! give him the money and get their table!
a: (walks up to the maitre d') excuse me...

q: (to the maitre d') good evening. (shakes his hand)
a: (finds his money) ahh-hahaha! (turns around to give the maitre d' his money, but he isn't there anymore)

q: here you go.
a: thank you gunther, put it there. (he gets up, and shakes gunther's hand. a bunch of coins fall out his hand. he sits down next to monica.) definitely not easier with coins. (joey gets up and picks up the coins. chandler thinks, joey is just helping him to pick them up.) thank you.

q: here. (gives her the coins) now i only owe you $49.50.
a: hey pheebs!

q: hey! (she sits down next to him)
a: if you wanna give joey a christmas present that disrupts the entire building, why not get him something a little bit more subtle, like a wrecking ball, or a vile of small pox to release in the hallway?

q: years and years ago there were these people called the maccabees...
a: (entering in a santa costume) ho, ho, ho! merry christmas!

q: santa! (runs to chandler and hugs him)
a: hey! (grunts as ben hits him at full speed.)

q: what are you doing here, santa?
a: well, i'm here to see my old buddy ben. what are you doing here, weird…turtle-man?

q: i'm the holiday armadillo, your part-jewish friend. you sent me here to give ben some presents. remember?
a: what?

q: did you bring me any presents, santa?
a: you bet i did, ben, put it there! (he shakes ben's hand, but the money falls out of his hands) (to monica) well, it would have worked this time, if his hands weren't so damn small! (realizes, that ben is standing right there) ho, ho, ho!

q: (to chandler) what are you doing?
a: you called everyone and said you were having trouble finding a santa costume, so i borrowed one from a guy at work!

q: thank you, but, but you gotta leave.
a: why?

q: because, i'm finally getting him excited about hanukkah, and, and you're-you’re wrecking it.
a: but i didn't get to shape my belly like a bowl full of jelly.

q: i'm sorry, chandler but this, this is really important to me.
a: fine, i'll give the suit back.

q: (to chandler) hey, you think, you can keep it another night? (she has a really teasing look on her face and keeps twirling chandler's beard.)
a: santa? really?

q: yes, is that okay?
a: did your dad ever dress up like santa?

q: no.
a: then it's okay! (they kiss.)

q: no! why does he have to go?
a: because, if santa and the holiday…armadillo? (ross nods) ...are ever in the same room for too long the universe will implode. merry christmas!

q: fine, i-i give up. santa, santa can stay.
a: well, i'll stay, but only because i wanna hear about hanukkah. ben, will you sit here with santa and learn about hanukkah?

q: yeah?
a: my favorite part was when superman flew all the jews out of egypt. (glaring at joey who’s nodding.)

q: joey, would you just come out here and stop being such a baby!
a: ohh. mmm.

q: (comes in the front door and walks towards the kitchen.) hi.
a: hey, you have got to try this cheesecake.

q: oh, y’know i'm not that much of a sweet tooth. i—(chandler puts a forkful of the cheesecake in her mouth.)—wow. my god, so creamy. oh my god, this is the best cheesecake i have ever had. where did you get this? (she reaches over to look at the label on the box.)
a: (nervously) it was at the front door. when i got home. somebody sent it to us.

q: chandler, this is not addressed to you. this is addressed to mrs. braverman downstairs. (gasping) thief.
a: i—no! i didn't read the box before i opened it. and you can't return a box after you've opened the box.

q: why, why not?
a: because it's too delicious.

q: chandler, you stole this cheesecake. that is wrong.
a: no-no-no! it is going to be okay, because mrs. braverman is gonna send away for a free one and that way we all win! the only losers are the big cheesecake conglomerate, (reading the label) momma’s little bakery. (pause) i feel terrible, i’m a horrible, horrible, horrible person.

q: all right, i should get going, big day a work. y’know i’m in a coma? today, they do this test on me and it turns out i’m not brain dead.
a: so…

q: okay. (joey exits.)
a: oh, what’s at 8:00?

q: my god, i can’t believe this! i mean i knew that mom and dad were invited, but i thought that was it! i mean from the ages 7 to 9 frannie and i were inseparable!
a: well, maybe since the age of 9, frannie’s made some new friends.

q: y’know, she tried to undress me too.
a: i used to undress my cousin glenn. (monica looks at him then sushes him.)

q: hi!
a: another cheesecake came! they delivered it to the wrong address again!

q: so just bring it back downstairs, what’s the problem?
a: i can’t seem to say goodbye.

q: are you serious?! chandler, we ate an entire cheesecake two days ago and you want more?
a: well i’ve forgotten what it tastes like okay?!

q: it was cheesecake. it was fine. it had a buttery, crumbly, graham cracker crust, with a very rich yet light, cream cheese filling… (pause) wow! my whole mouth just filled with saliva!
a: (closing the box) y’know what? forget it! we are just hungry! we have not had lunch! we are just light-headed! so let us go out and have lunch and forget about the cheesecake.

q: yeah and we’ll drop it off downstairs so that we’re not tempted.
a: good idea. where do you want to go to lunch?

q: (laughs) we’ll see.
a: well, thank you for lunch.

q: what? wait a minute, i didn’t pay, i thought you paid!
a: so apparently we just don’t pay for food anymore. (rachel laughs then chandler notices something.) do you see what i see?

q: (gasps) its still there! (the cheesecake they returned to mrs. braverman is still lying in front of her door.)
a: mrs. braverman must be out. (they move closer to it.)

q: she could be out of town. maybe she’ll be gone for months.
a: by then, the cheesecake may have gone bad. we don’t want her to come back to bad cheesecake.

q: no that could kill her.
a: well, we don’t want that.

q: no so we’re protecting her.
a: but we should take it.

q: but we should move quick.
a: why?

q: because i think i just heard her moving around in there.
a: go! go! go! go! go! go! go! go! go! go! (rachel grabs the cheesecake and they take off upstairs.)

q: (taking a bite) oh my god! that is so good!
a: i’m full, and yet i know if i stop eating this, i’ll regret it.

q: oh it’s umm, it’s tofu cake. do you want some? (he makes a disgusted noise and heads for his room, chandler follows him in.)
a: what are you doing tonight?

q: huh? uh… (he starts taking off his pants.)
a: dude! dude! (motions that joey should pull up his pants.)

q: oh! (pulls up his pants.) sorry. uh, i’ve got those plans with phoebe, why?
a: oh really? uh, monica said she had a date at 9:00.

q: what?! tonight?!
a: that’s what monica said.

q: oh, you’re such a gentleman. (grabs his arm.) come on! we’re going to my place! (drags him off to her place.)
a: are you eating the cheesecake without me?!

q: (with a mouthful) mm-mmm. (nods no.)
a: i will give you a hundred dollars to whistle right now. (she tries to whistle and blows little chunks of cheesecake out of her mouth.) how can you eat the cheesecake without me?!

q: oh, what are you going to do?! are you gonna go run tell monica?! are you gonna tell joey?! no! because then you will have to tell them what we did! we are desert stealers! we are living outside the law!
a: y’know what? i don’t trust you with this cake anymore! and i got it first, and i’m takin’ it back! (grabs the cheesecake and heads for his apartment.)

q: what?! what?!
a: oh yes!

q: wait a minute!
a: oh yes!

q: oh no-no-no-no-no, no you don’t!
a: oh yes! oh yes!

q: you think i trust you with it?! no! we’re gonna split it! you take half and i take half!
a: well that’s not fair, you’ve already had some!

q: what? oh, well then y’know what? i think monica would be very interested to know that you called her cheesecake dry and mealy.
a: what do we use to split it?

q: okay! (grabs a knife and cuts it in half.) all right, pick a half.
a: (examining the cake) okay well, this side looks bigger. uh… there’s more crust on this side. y’know? so, maybe if i measured…

q: oh for god sake just pick a piece!
a: all right, i’ll pick that one. (points.)

q: that’s also the smaller piece. (puts the piece onto a plate.) okay, there you go. enjoy your half my friend, but that is it. no sharing. no switching, and don’t come crying to me if you eat your piece to fast. (as she’s saying that she is backing out the door, when she finishes she turns around to return to her place, stumbles and drops the cheesecake on the floor.) oh!!!!
a: (gloatingly and holding his piece) ohhh!

q: okay, you gotta give me some of your piece.
a: oh-ho-ho-ho-no! no! no switching! no sharing, and don’t come crying to me! ha-ha-ha! i may just sit here and have my cake all day! just sit here in the hallway and eat my… (rachel knocks the plate from his hand and it falls on the floor. that process leaves just the forkful chandler has, rachel starts to go after that little bit and chandler retreats into his apartment.)

q: oh! yay! look! there’s a piece that doesn’t have floor on it!
a: stick to your side!

q: (looking up) there it is! oh, look at that! isn’t mother nature amazing?
a: (looking up with her) that’s a plane!

q: okay, we’ve been out here for two hours and we haven’t seen any stupid comets. can we go now? i mean, chandler’s getting chilly. (she walks over to where chandler is bundled up in a big coat and shivering.)
a: (with a quivering voice) no, i’m not!

q: then why are you wearing monica’s jacket?
a: because it’s flattering! (shivers harder) come on monica! come on monica! (he goes inside.)

q: (covering his ears and yelling) oh no! no! no! (he starts banging on the door.)
a: (whispering) monica!

q: she’s sleeping.
a: i know, just quick-quick question, quick question. which one was deep impact and which one was armageddon?

q: deep impact was the one with robert duval, armageddon is what’s going to happen to you if you wake me up.
a: sorry, i just…can’t sleep. ooh! (turns on the light and monica groans.) where is that book that you are reading with the two women who were ice-skating and wearing, wearing those hats with the flowers on it? because every time i look at that cover i’m like…(fake snores.)

q: it is in the living room where there is also a light! and no one will kick you in the shin.
a: what?! (monica kicks him in the shin.) ow! (he gets out of bed and heads into the living room.)

q: (to joey) i know, i wasn’t finished. (joey motions him to finish.) (yelling at the street) but don’t worry! we’re gonna go down the fire escape!!
a: shhhhhhhhh!!! (monica enters) i’m sorry, i thought maybe i’d make some warm milk and it would help me sleep.

q: with a wok? (chandler’s holding a wok.) i thought you were going to read my boring book to put you asleep.
a: it got interesting! damn you oprah!

q: here, let me make the milk, i’m up anyway.
a: hey, y’know what we can do? y’know, now that we are up? we can just like talk to each other all night long, y’know like we did when we were first going out. it’d be fun!

q: okay that does sound like fun.
a: okay, so how bummed were you when the second sister died huh?

q: the second sister dies?!
a: (pause) no. no, i-i was, i was talking about the book i was reading.

q: the second sister dies in archie and jughead double digest?
a: that’s correct.

q: okay, here’s your milk. what do you want to talk about? (she sees that chandler has fallen asleep and slams the door loudly to wake him up.)
a: (startled) what? what? what?

q: are you still awake?
a: yeah! you?

q: you do know that was me who just said that right? (he doesn’t respond and she turns on the light, waking him.) hey. as long as we’re both up…
a: (intrigued) yeah? (monica nods yes.) i hope you’re not thinking about cleaning the living room.

q: what?! what are you doing?!
a: do you know what just happened?

q: yeah. we-we had sex and then we fell asleep.
a: no. we were in the middle of sex…and you fell asleep.

q: nooo! no, that’s not true. no, best time ever! yeah, you rocked me world! (she turns out the light to go back to sleep.)
a: (turning the light back on) monica?

q: what?!
a: i was giving you some of my best moves, and you missed it. so please wake up so we can do it right!

q: okay. okay, i’m ready. come on big fella!
a: okay.

q: give me the good stuff.
a: yeah! (monica falls asleep) no! no! no! don’t fall asleep! okay, i am going to make you some coffee. (monica doesn’t move as he gets out of bed and as he’s heading for the door.) and i probably won’t spill coffee grounds all over the kitchen floor.

q: that really was some of your best work.
a: hm-hmm, i told you! (looks at the clock) i can’t believe that i’ve only got two hours before i call in sick for work.

q: i have to be up in seven minutes.
a: well, you’re not gonna believe this, but if you have seven minutes…

q: really?!
a: do you wanna?

q: hey, y’know what’s weird? after you guys get married, when you introduce me to people you’re gonna have to say, "this is my brother-in-law ross." not, "my friend ross," "brother-in-law ross." that’s weird isn’t it?
a: couldn’t i just say, "this is ross?"

q: (on phone) uh, hello dad! monica and i just saw the house in the paper! (listens) yes we’re surprised! (listens) who did you leave a message with?
a: (knocking on the window while outside) sorry! (runs off.)

q: no. (pause) oh wait yes! i do, i do have one question. what is toner?
a: joey! joe! (sees that he’s not here and starts investigating. he picks up the bag of chips.) full bag. (he picks up the beer.) beer’s still cold. something terrible must’ve happened here! (he decides it’s not that important; sits down on rosita, and the back falls off causing him to flip over.) oh no-no-no-no-no-no! (runs over to stevie.) stevie, i was never here! (runs out.)

q: oh yeah? i work in a cubicle surrounded by people. i’ve been talking to you for five minutes now about killing myself and no one’s even looked up from their desk. hang-hang on. (to the people standing around his cubicle.) hey everybody! uh, i’m gonna kill myself! (there’s no response; no one even looks up.) i’ll get back to ya. (to phoebe) i got nothing. wait. (he sets the phone down.) uh, hey marge! (mimes putting a gun to his head, pulling the trigger, and splattering his brain on the wall behind him. then points to himself. marge watches this, then goes back to work.) (to phoebe) ehh, nothing. nothing.
a: my chair. now, if anybody asks, your name is rosita! (he runs out the door, grabs the back of rosita, and we can hear joey and rachel talking as they are coming up the stairs. neither of them have reached the landing yet.)

q: hey chandler!
a: hey!

q: how would you like to sit in a chair that fully reclines, has a rolling massage, and speakers in the head rest?
a: yeah, i’d love to but i’ve tried that so many times they won’t even let me in the store anymore.

q: well what if i told you, you can do it in my apartment?
a: (excitedly) are you telling me that you bought the chair that is making all other lounge systems obsolete? the chair that sit magazine called the chair of the year?

q: i just purchased the la-z-boy e-cliner 3000. (which is an actual product by the way, i’m not sure about the 3000 part.)

a: ...and beer!!

q: (looking at monica's legs) wow!

q: ok, don’t hold thy breath!

q: we weren’t picking up, it’s amanda!
a: (to amanda) i get pedicures!

q: (contemplates for a few moments what rachel just said) nah! i don't have another level!!

q: i went to that tanning place your wife suggested.

q: oh oh! what is up with miss hawaiian tropic?

q: (sees what he is doing) chandler, stop! it is not going to pop open!
a: (without taking his eyes off the bra) you don't know! (monica just smiles)

q: we are not friends with phoebe anymore.

q: ooh, that accident must have been terrible. you look positively ghastly.

q: i don't know.

q: yeah, was there a part of you that... felt like it was... really wrong?
a: actually, no. no, it felt right. you know, it felt like uhm... i can't believe we haven't been doing this the whole time. i can tell from your expressions that that's the good news you were hoping for... well, i'm gonna go continue to... spread the joy.(chandler leaves the apartment. joey sighs)

q: yeah, me too. ooh, yeah, i'm not going anywhere for a while.
a: dude, it's chandler. let me in.

q: go away! i don't want to see anybody.
a: i know, i went to the tanning place and the same thing happened to me. you have to let me in.

q: really? did you count mississipily? dude, you're not tanned.
a: no, i just had to get a picture of this. i see you later!

q: hey!
a: honey, i got us that room at the woodford inn this weekend.

q: hey!
a: hey hey! where's the birthday girl?

q: oh, she's still napping

q: i can't believe emma is still asleep!

q: (into receiver) hello? (listens) oh no! what happened? (listens some more) ok ok, where are you? (grabs a pen and starts writing). ok, i'll be right there. (puts the phone down)
a: was that emma? is she up?

q: all right, you know what? we don't have a choice. it's like i would have said in that sci-fi movie if i'd gotten the part. "those are our men in there, we have to get them out! even if i have to sacrifice the most important thing in my life; my time-machine."
a: did that movie ever get made?

q: (yelling) don't worry, you guys, we're gonna get you out of there.
a: and we're also gonna buy you tiny, bird hearing-aids.

q: okay. here goes.
a: what's the matter?

q: i need to say goodbye to the table first.
a: i understand.

q: okay. table, you have given us so many great times. and you guys, jordan, victor, joel... all of you guys. what can i say? you guys make us look good. you wanna say anything?
a: i don't know. except that, for one last time... (he touches the players as he says the following) good game, good game, good game, good game, good game, good game, good game.

q: okay, here we go. i can't do it.
a: well, i can't do it either.

q: yeah, they're stuck inside the table!
a: we have to bust it open, but neither of us can do it!

q: alright. my job here is done.
a: that was... impressive.

q: yeah, they were just slowing me down. alright, i have to get back to the babies. i'll see you girls later.
a: sorry about the table, man.

q: yeah.
a: you gonna buy a new one?

q: probably not. nah. i don't know how much i'm gonna wanna play after you go.
a: well, at least we got these little guys out.

q: yeah.
a: aww, we were worried about you! hm. i guess i better get used to things crapping in my hand, huh?

q: i'm gonna miss these little guys. it was nice having birds around again.
a: hey, you know what? maybe we should keep them here with you.

q: what?
a: yeah, i mean we've got a lot going on right now. and, plus, here they'd have their own room.

q: i could get a goose!
a: you know, i - i think you're set with the poultry.

q: thanks man. did you hear that, you guys? you're gonna get to stay here! and, and it's good, you know, 'cause, 'cause now you have a reason to come visit.
a: i think there may be another reason. so, awkward hug or lame cool guy handshake?

q: well, that's it. everything's packed.
a: wow, this is weird.

q: yeah, yeah, he talked to her, but she got on the plane anyway.
a: where's ross?

q: has it always been purple?
a: (to his children) look around, you guys. this was your first home. and it was a happy place, filled with love and laughter. but more important, because of rent control, it was a friggin' steal!

q: oh, honey, i forgot. i promised treeger that we'd leave our keys.
